title: What are the socio-cultural influences that caused the realism movement? - Quora

response.answer_text: Romantic gesturalism and rule-based academicism were alike exhausted by the time of the failed revolutions of the mid-19th century. Rapid industrialisation in Europe had both utterly transformed (or deformed) the physical environment and deepened class divisions between a nouveau-riche, acquisitive and philistine bourgeoisie and a wretchedly impoverished industrial proletariat. An aristocratic, refined cultural norm was now an irrelevant memory. Art and literature responded to the harshness of industrial society by exploring its impact on the physical landscape and human experience.

” DEBT “ seems to be the factor for people realizing that hunger and getting from point A to point B is something no one really needs, and is a limiting factor that can be dealt with and controlled. By Robert Evan Howard / aslodge. com
